senses.de: A number of connected items or names written or printed consecutively, typically one below the other.
senses.ex: Here is a list of things I need to buy from the grocery store.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: Understand when a 'list' is expected, like for shopping or tasks, to help you communicate efficiently.
Tips.example: Grocery lists help avoid forgetting items.

Tips.title: Order Implications
Tips.description: The order in a list can imply priority, with the first often being the most important.
Tips.example: My list starts with 'buy milk', since it's urgent.

Tips.title: List vs. Sentence
Tips.description: Use lists for clarity and conciseness over long sentences when detailing items or steps.
Tips.example: Shopping's easier with a bullet-point list.

senses.de: To write or print a number of connected items or names consecutively, typically one below the other.
senses.ex: She listed all the items she needed to get from the store.

Tips.title: Verb Consistency
Tips.description: When 'listing' items verbally, maintain a consistent format to aid comprehension.
Tips.example: My meal plan lists breakfast, lunch, and dinner options.

Tips.title: Clarity in Instructions
Tips.description: When directing others, 'list' steps to follow clearly to ensure tasks are completed correctly.

senses.de: A strip or border of a specified material or color running along the edge of a fabric, especially one lengthwise on a carpet.
senses.ex: The list on the edge of the carpet is a beautiful contrast.

Tips.title: Visual Effect
Tips.description: A 'list' in textile terms can add visual appeal or serve as a functional border.
Tips.example: This rug's blue list matches the room.

senses.de: The action of a ship leaning to one side.
senses.ex: The ship began to list to the right because of the storm.

Tips.title: Safety Relevance
Tips.description: In maritime contexts, a 'list' is critical—indicating potential danger or instability.
Tips.example: Correct the list to stabilize the vessel!

Tips.title: Direction Specific
Tips.description: The direction of a list (right or left) provides specific information essential in navigation.
Tips.example: The ship lists to the left, adjust cargo!

senses.de: The action of enlisting in an army or other military service.
senses.ex: He decided to list in the army after he graduated.

Tips.title: Commitment Step
Tips.description: Using 'list' in a military context conveys a decision to commit to service.
Tips.example: After college, she plans to list in the navy.

Catalogue.wordDefinition:
A catalogue is a more detailed and comprehensive collection of items that usually includes descriptions, pictures, and prices.

It is often used by businesses to showcase their products or services. For example, furniture stores may have a catalogue of their products that customers can browse through to see what is available.

It can be used for various purposes such as making a grocery list, to-do list or a guest list for a party. Lists are usually shorter than catalogues and are meant to be easily understood without any unnecessary information.

A catalogue is more detailed and used by businesses to showcase their products, while a list is simpler and can be used for various purposes.

Directory.wordDefinition:
A directory is a structured database that stores information about files or folders on a computer or network.

A directory is like a virtual folder that contains lists of files, subdirectories, and other data.

A directory is a type of list that provides a structured way to organize and access files and folders on a computer or network, while a list is a collection of items that can be used for a variety of purposes.

Directories are used in operating systems, file managers, and network protocols, while lists can be used in everyday life for tasks such as making a grocery list or creating a to-do list.

Index.wordDefinition:
Index and list both refer to items organized in a certain order.

However, there is a difference in how they are used. An index is a tool used to quickly find specific information within a book or document.

An index is used for finding information quickly within a book or document, while a list is used to organize items for personal or public use.

Inventory.wordDefinition:
Inventory refers to a comprehensive record of goods or items available in stock for sale or use. It includes details such as item description, quantity, and value.

Inventory is mainly used in business or trade when keeping track of goods owned or available for sale.

Inventory is used to keep track of goods in stock, while a list is a simple record of items in a specific order.

Record.wordDefinition:
The main difference between the words list and record is that a list is a series of items written down or verbally communicated in a particular order, whereas a record is a written or electronic document that contains information about an event, person, or thing.

Record is typically used to describe a more formalized document that contains information about a particular subject or event.

For example, a medical record contains information about a patient's health history, while a criminal record contains information about a person's criminal history.

A record can also refer to a written or electronic document of transactions, such as a sales record or a financial record.

A list is more casual and used to keep track of things or tasks, while a record is more formal and used to document or record important information.

Register.wordDefinition: Register refers to an official or formal record of something. For instance, you may need to register for a class or register your car with the DMV.

Roll.wordDefinition:
Roll is usually defined as a document or list that is in a rolled-up form or a cylindrical form.

It can refer to a register or list of names, a roll call, or a list of bills or documents.

In simple terms, lists are generally flat and linear, while rolls are cylindrical and often contain more complex information.

Lists can be used for organizing, planning, and tracking, while rolls are often used for official records and archives.

Roster.wordDefinition:
Both list and roster refer to a group of items or people, but differ slightly in their usage.

A roster is a list of names or people organized in a specific order, such as a sports team roster or a work schedule roster.

List is a more general term used for grouping any related items, while roster specifically refers to a list of people organized in a specific order.

quotes.Text: It took me a long time to find out that I was born to be an actor. It was the last thing on my list, although my list was very small. I didn't know what to do. But kids weren't supposed to know what to do back then; we were all cute and we'd find out what we'd do later in life.
quotes.Title: Dutch Actor
quotes.Name: Rutger Hauer

quotes.Text: A good way to take a baby step into the world of animal rights is to make a list of small things you can do to help your issue and work your way up to the big things. Make a promise to do one thing on your list each month.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Jenna Morasca

quotes.Text: A lot of children don't find forever homes because they're on that special-needs list, even if it's because of something as simple as her mother smoked cigarettes for a month, not knowing she was pregnant.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Katherine Heigl

quotes.Text: I guess I'm the happiest when I'm picking up my kids from school. The most important things on my list are my wife and kids and my health. Happiness is having a family you love.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Phil Hellmuth

quotes.Text: I've never been able to say I've been influenced by a list of artists I like because I like thousands and thousands and I've been influenced in some way by all of them.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jack Nicholson

quotes.Text: My mom always talks about how hard it was to grow up in a political family. It's always split up, and just - I want to have fun in life. No, politics isn't on the list.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Patrick Schwarzenegger

quotes.Text: I am big on writing to-do lists and having new goals to reach all the time, as it keeps me motivated and inspired.
quotes.Title: Canadian Athlete
quotes.Name: Natalya Neidhart

quotes.Text: Everybody in their life has a list of what they want to do: I'm very lucky indeed to do one thing on that list.
quotes.Title: British Journalist
quotes.Name: Roddy Llewellyn

quotes.Text: I respect people's opinion. Everybody has they own 'pound for pound' list.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Bernard Hopkins

quotes.Text: When I die, I'd like' Friends' to be listed behind 'helping people.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Matthew Perry
